title: PermaFrost NMR Global Impact Analysis
description: Extrapolation of documented energy savings to global scale with conservative factors applied

methodology.note: 50% conservative factor applied to all extrapolations to account for variability in system types, climates, and operating conditions
methodology.basis: Extrapolations derived from 254 PE-certified, IPMVP-compliant field measurements

co2_methodology.approach: Weighted marginal emission factor based on study locations
co2_methodology.rationale: Field studies were concentrated in high-carbon grids (Midwest/PJM). The effective factor reflects actual displaced generation at measurement sites, not theoretical US average.
co2_methodology.reference: See grid_emissions_factors.json for regional marginal rates

extrapolated_impact_100k_systems.description: Conservative extrapolation for 100,000+ systems treated worldwide

one_percent_global_adoption.description: If 1% of global commercial HVAC systems used PermaFrost NMR

ten_percent_global_adoption.description: If 10% of global commercial HVAC systems used PermaFrost NMR

climate_impact_equivalents.note: Based on EPA Greenhouse Gas Equivalencies Calculator

regional_analysis.note: For location-specific CO2 calculations, grid_emissions_factors.json provides average emission rates for all 27 eGRID subregions
regional_analysis.regional_variation: US grid carbon intensity varies 5.7x by subregion (274.6 to 1,575.4 lbs CO2/MWh)

data_sources.co2_conversion: EPA eGRID marginal (non-baseload) emission factors, weighted by study locations
data_sources.co2_conversion_note: Effective rate ~1,558 lbs/MWh reflects high-carbon grids where studies were conducted
data_sources.regional_factors: corpus/grid_emissions_factors.json - EPA eGRID 2022 average output rates for all 27 subregions

Conservative extrapolation (100,000 systems): $329 million annual cost savings
Conservative extrapolation (100,000 systems): 1.71 million tonnes CO2 avoided
Climate equivalent: 372,000 passenger vehicles removed from roads
Climate equivalent: 2 million acres of forest absorbing carbon
50% conservative factor applied to all extrapolations
